companyDescription:
Inter-Power Group est une entreprise de service œuvrant dans le domaine des compresseurs à air industriels. De par les bannières Compresseurs Québec au Québec (Ville Saint-Laurent, St-Germain-de-Grantham, Sherbrooke et Boisbriand), et ReapAir Compressor services en Ontario (Toronto), l’entreprise couvre un vaste territoire. En plus d’être le plus grand détaillant Quincy en Amérique du Nord, Inter-Power se démarque également comme leader dans le domaine de l’air comprimé. Or, la croissance d’Inter-Power ne serait possible sans le dynamisme et l’engagement de ses employés. 

L’actif le plus important de la compagnie est son personnel. Il est donc essentiel de former une équipe où l’atmosphère et le climat de travail font en sorte que chacun y obtienne une satisfaction d’emploi tout en visant à atteindre les objectifs et les buts de l’entreprise. 


Nos valeurs:

v  Responsabilisation

v Satisfaction clientèle

v  Rigueur, qualité et efficacité

v  Travail d'équipe

v  Respect

v  Engagement

v  Intégrité



Un peu plus sur l'entreprise...

Fondée en 1985, Inter-Power est aujourd'hui chef de file pour tout ce qui traite d'air comprimé et n'associe son nom qu'avec les marques de grande renommée, telles que Quincy, GlobalVac, Kobelco KNW Series et Great Lakes. Que ce soit pour la vente, le service ou l'installation, nous garantissons un service de qualité à tous nos clients à travers le Québec, mais aussi en Ontario. La qualité et l'efficacité sont au cœur de nos aspirations. Nous offrons un service 24 heures à nos clients, limitant ainsi les inquiétudes et assurant le bon fonctionnement de leur entreprise en tout temps. Recherchant constamment l'atteinte de l'excellence doublée de la satisfaction de nos employés, nous innovons sans cesse dans le but de dépasser les attentes et mieux répondre aux besoins.
description:
Are you a talented, entrepreneurial, and technical salesperson motivated to help customers optimize the performance of their systems with industry leading products and services? Are you looking for a challenging new position where you can be very successful, have development opportunities, manage a territory with growth potential and work with a great support team? If yes, you may be the next great team member to join the Preston Phipps team.
The chosen candidate will be responsible for building the business in the assigned territory. To be successful in this position, one needs to build credibility, establish trusting relationships, develop intimate understanding of end users’ systems and the end users’ objectives to identify opportunities, which can be very big. This is a challenging and competitive industry, and the successful candidate needs to be determined and smart about their approach, picking the best opportunities to pursue, balancing their time between end users, contractors, and engineering consultants while navigating internal resources and maintaining an expert level of knowledge on an extensive list of technical products. The challenge and the potential of this role go hand in hand.
Celebrating 90 years, Preston Phipps Inc. is a nationally established specialty manufacturing representative firm working with the institutional, commercial, and industrial sectors. We specialize in market leading products and services in Steam, Hydronic Heating, Hot Water, HVAC, and Critical Air products. While built on distribution, Preston Phipps has evolved to offer specialty design, engineered product selection, skid production and even turnkey installations. Preston Phipps is part of FCG, Flow Control Group, a family of over 80 companies in North America.
This position will be covering the commercial and institutional markets in the Ottawa region (covering approximatively Kingston to Ottawa).
Responsibilities:

 Take ownership of developing the sales of the assigned territory.
 Maintain a business plan for the developing the territory inline with company objectives, including:

- Annual sales forecasts and individual account goals- Maintaining a top account list in terms of current volume, potential growth, and development plans for each.- Planned initiatives and call objectives.

 Identify new prospects through networking, industry event participation (trade associations, trade shows, and technical seminars), and even hosting product demonstrations.
 Be an expert on Preston Phipps products, their application and how they optimize customer systems.
 Guide and educate end users, contractors, and engineering consultants on selecting the best equipment to optimize the end user’s system.
 Deliver formal and informal training on product selection, application, and system optimization.
 Build relationships and facilitate a network of end users, engineering consultants and contractors. The ability to identify the decision makers and the influences is important.
 Build relationships with Preston Phipps manufacturing partners and Preston Phipps Divisions to deepen your technical resources. When available, leverage them through joint sales calls with accounts.
 Work with other territory managers to develop multi location accounts.
 Strike an optimal balance between your top accounts, ongoing projects, and prospecting to manage your sales funnel balancing near term and medium-term growth opportunities.
 Prioritize in-person meetings with accounts.
 Lead take offs on bid and spec projects that your assigned engineers have specified.
 Document projects to hand off to the project delivery team.
 Maintain CRM (customer relationship management) tool with contacts, pipeline, opportunities, and forecasts.
 Collect and share information on competition, market, and industry trends with leadership team.
 Attend internal sales meetings prepared to give updates on quotes, orders, and development in territory.

Requirements:

 Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering is preferred.

- Applicants with Engineering Technologist, equivalent industry experience, and technical sales experience are encouraged to apply.

 3 to 5 years' experience in a similar position or field is preferred.
 Experience in HVAC, hydronics, industrial, laboratory or controls are favorable.
 Excellent communication, follow up, organizational and project tracking skills.
 Commitment to driving sales and being active in the territory.
 Disciplined, driven, professional and with a positive work ethic.
 Strong technical acumen and problem-solving capacity.
 Driver’s licence and clean driving record.
 Alignment with our values of Entrepreneurship, Integrity, Respect, Partnership, Success, and Innovation.

Only selected candidates will be contacted. We would like to thank all applicants for your interest in Preston Phipps Inc.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:

 Dental care
 Disability insurance
 Extended health care
 Life insurance
 Vision care

Flexible Language Requirement:

 French not required

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

 Commission pay

Work Location: In person
